unnormalised: **Air Quality in Delhi-NCR Remains a Concern, Educational Initiatives Launched**
normalised: **Air Quality in Delhi-N C R Remains a Concern, Educational Initiatives Launched**

unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the Delhi-NCR region continues to be a pressing environmental concern, particularly during the winter months. The System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR) reported an average Air Quality Index (AQI) of 185 at 07:00 hrs on 16/11/2024, classified as “Moderate.”
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the Delhi-N C R region continues to be a pressing environmental concern, particularly during the winter months. The System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (S A F A R) reported an average Air Quality Index (A Q I) of one hundred and eighty five at seven o'clock hours on sixteenth november two thousand and twenty four, classified as “Moderate.”

unnormalised: Contributing factors include vehicular emissions, industrial activity, and stubble burning in neighboring states like Haryana and Punjab. IIT Kanpur is collaborating with the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) on research projects aimed at identifying pollution hotspots and developing effective mitigation strategies.
normalised: Contributing factors include vehicular emissions, industrial activity, and stubble burning in neighboring states like Haryana and Punjab. I I T Kanpur is collaborating with the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (D P C C) on research projects aimed at identifying pollution hotspots and developing effective mitigation strategies.

unnormalised: Educational initiatives are being rolled out in schools across Delhi, focusing on raising awareness about the detrimental health effects of air pollution, especially on children like little Riya and Rohan. A campaign titled "Swachh Hawa, Swasth Jeevan" (Clean Air, Healthy Life) was launched on 14/11/2024, Children's Day. It promotes the use of public transport, carpooling, and planting more trees. The goal is to reduce PM2.5 levels by 15% by 2025. Furthermore, the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) will be implemented more stringently this year if the AQI worsens, starting from 01/12/2024. Individuals can check real-time AQI data and report violations through the DPCC mobile app.
